nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: First day of the new semester at Universiti Sains Malaysia. The hallway buzzes with students catching up after the holidays.  Colourful posters line the walls — something about 'Sustainability Week'.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: MINGGU KELESTARIAN USM — Talks, gotong-royong, food bank volunteering. Sign up at the cafeteria or scan the QR code!

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: A senior student checking his phone. He looks like he's waiting for someone.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: Your coursemate, Aisyah.  She's always involved in campus activities.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The noticeboard is covered with event posters. One catches your eye — 'Be the Change:  SDG Campus Challenge'.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Eh, kau!  Over here lah!  You saw all the new posters around campus or not?

choices.text: Yeah, something about SDGs right? Looks interesting.
SDG? What's that ah? First time hearing.
Aiya, more activities ah? Already got so much assignment.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Ha ah!  Sustainable Development Goals.  The uni is doing a whole week about it. Got 17 goals covering everything from poverty to climate change.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Best part is they're connecting it to stuff we can actually do on campus. Not just theory theory only.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Wah, you don't know meh? SDG is Sustainable Development Goals lah. Like education equality, clean water, climate action...  big stuff.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Don't worry, I also blur blur at first. But apparently even small things we do on campus can contribute.  Interesting right?

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Haiya, I know lah you busy.  But think about it — we already spending time here, might as well do something meaningful kan?

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Betul tu.  You don't have to save the whole world.  Just do sikit sikit. Small actions also count what.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Anyway, Prof Razak's class today is about this SDG thing. Jom, later we kena tegur for being late pulak.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: New objective: Attend Prof Razak's class to learn how SDGs connect to campus life.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The lecture hall fills up quickly. Prof Razak, known for his passionate teaching style, adjusts his microphone.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: Prof Razak has been teaching Sustainability Studies for 15 years. Students say his classes change perspectives.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: A student furiously taking notes.  Seems really into the topic.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: Selamat pagi, everyone. Today we're going to talk about something bigger than your CGPA — the Sustainable Development Goals.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: Ada 17 SDGs.  They cover kemiskinan, pendidikan, climate change, kesaksamaan...  and we'll connect them to your lives right here in USM.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: Last semester, some seniors worked with the campus food bank. They helped redistribute surplus food from Dewan Makan to students yang memerlukan.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: Now, be honest with me.  How many of you actually believe students like you boleh buat perubahan?

choices.text: If we work together, I think we can make a difference.
Honestly Prof, it feels quite far from us.  We're just students.
Susah lah Prof. We got assignments, exams...  where got time?

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: Bagus!  That's the spirit. Change always starts with a small group of people who take things seriously.  Campus is the perfect place to experiment.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: I understand that feeling. That's exactly why your projects this semester will focus on real issues around you.  Make it personal.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: I hear this every semester. But you know what? By the end of this course, I hope you'll surprise yourself.  Give yourself a chance.

nodes.speaker: Prof Razak
nodes.text: The food bank I mentioned tadi — they're looking for volunteers this week. Sorting, packing, distributing.  Siapa interested, sign up at the caf.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: (bisik) Eh, food bank tu sounds interesting kan? Real hands-on experience, not just sitting in class.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: New idea unlocked: Campus Food Bank Volunteering (SDG 2: Zero Hunger)

nodes.speaker: Student
nodes.text: Honestly...  I thought SDGs were just another poster thing. But the food bank example tu real lah.  Students helping students.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: Poster:  SDG 4 — Quality Education.  'Pendidikan bukan sekadar peperiksaan.  It's about access, support, and equal opportunity for all. '

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: Poster:  SDG 13 — Climate Action. 'Tabiat kecil di kampus jadi besar:  penggunaan tenaga, sisa makanan, pilihan pengangkutan. '

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The cafeteria is busy with the lunch crowd. You spot Aisyah and Danial at your usual table near the SDG poster wall.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: Aisyah and Danial are deep in conversation, pointing at something on Aisyah's phone.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: Mei Ling from the Student Council.  She's always organizing something.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Eh, you checking out those SDG posters too? They actually put some effort into these designs ah.

nodes.speaker: Mei Ling
nodes.text: Oh, hi!  You're in Prof Razak's class right? The food bank sign-up is over there if you're interested!

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Finally!  Sini sini.  How was the rest of class? Prof Razak always goes overtime one.

choices.text: Actually quite eye-opening. Never thought about SDGs that way before.
Intense lah, but at least it's about something real. Not just memorizing facts.
Same lah, lecture is lecture. I was half asleep honestly.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Right? ! The SDG stuff makes everything feel...  bigger than just chasing grades.  Like we're part of something.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: At least it's not just theory theory. Prof Razak always brings real examples.  The food bank thing quite inspiring.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Aiya, you ah.  Always like that. But seriously, the food bank part was good. You should have paid attention.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Anyway, we were just talking about that food bank. They're asking for student helpers this week.  Sorting and packing food after classes.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: It's at the old surau building, you know the one near Desasiswa? Only 2-3 hours.  What do you think?  Nak join tak?

choices.text: Count me in.  I want to see how it actually works.
Hmm, let me check my schedule first. Got tutorial tomorrow.
Eh, I don't know lah. Not really my thing, all this volunteering stuff.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Yes! Best lah.  We go together. I'll add you to the WhatsApp group. They got free milo after volunteering also tau!

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Okay okay, no pressure. But even one day also helps. Just let us know.  We go every Thursday after 4.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Hmm, okay lah. But think about it?  You don't have to be perfect for this. Just show up and help sikit.  That's already a lot.

nodes.speaker: Danial
nodes.text: Alright, enough serious talk.  Jom makan dulu, saving the world later. The nasi lemak here today quite sedap.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: End of Chapter 1: Awareness Begins.  You've learned about SDGs and the opportunity to get involved. What will you choose to do?
